description: Pentecostalism is a worldwide Christian movement emphasizing the work of the Holy Spirit, spiritual gifts, and contemporary worship practices. It includes a broad range of independent churches, national fellowships, and international networks.
ecclesiology: Congregational or network-based governance; some hierarchical international fellowships exist, but local churches generally autonomous
soteriology: Emphasis on personal conversion, baptism in the Holy Spirit, and experiential faith; sanctification and ongoing spiritual growth central
sacramental_theology: Ordinances only: believer's baptism (usually by immersion) and communion; frequent emphasis on healing, prophecy, and tongues
social_ethics: Evangelism, missionary activity, disaster relief, social development, holistic community care
ecumenical_theology: Generally cooperative within evangelical networks; selective dialogue with other traditions while maintaining distinctives
